_header: Sithen this world was full of onde
Subjects: sermons, verse in; evils of the time
_description: Truth and Love imprisoned (4 lines), a tag in the Fasciculus morum

BodLauMis213.Transcription:
Sethyn þis world was full of hondetreuþe & loue
                    haþ leyn in bondewher for þu lord þat art a bouelytle
                    þat honde & sende vs loue

BodLauMis111.Transcription:
Sithen þis world was ful of hondeTreuthe & loue hath leyn in
                    bondeWere fore þou lord þat art a boueliye þat honde
                    & send vs loue

Bod410.Transcription:
Sithen þis world was ful of hondeTrewth & loue has leyn in
                    bondeWherfore þu lord þat art a bouelitle þat honde
                    & send vs loue amen
Bod410.Editions:
Little,  Andrew George. 
             Studies in English Franciscan History.
         Manchester: Manchester UP; London: Longman’s, 1917: 155.

BodRawC670.Transcription:
Sithen þis world was ful of ondeTrewth & love has leyn in
                    [bonde]Wherfore þou lord þat art aboueLethe þat bonde
                    and sende vs loue
BodRawC670.Editions:
Wenzel,  Siegfried. 
             Verses in Sermons: ‘Fasciculus morum’ and Its Middle
                English Poems.
         Cambridge, MA: Medieval Academy of America, 1978: 154.

CamGon364.Transcription:
Sethyn þis werd was ful on stoundeTrewthe & loue han leyn
                    boundeQwerfore þou lord þat art a bouelitle þat hate
                    and send us loue

EDU82.Transcription:
Sen this world was full of ondeTreuthe and love hathe lyen in
                    bondeLyttull that onde and sende vs love

Lincoln44.Transcription:
Sythen þus world was ful of hondeTreþe an loue haþ
                    layde in bondeWar for þu lord þat art abowehye þat
                    boneþe and send vs loue

WorcF19.Transcription:
Sethen þis wordele was foul of wondetreuþe and loue hat
                    layn yboundewer for þou lord þat ert a bouelay þat
                    londe & sende loue
